Tandem Seals

right) serves as a backup the primary cated by a nonpressurized barrier fluid. The secondary seal also serves as a second "defense" for containing emissions. Under normal conditions, weepage from the primary seal is contained in the nonpressurized barrier fluid and typically vented off to a flare system. In the event that the primary seal should fail, the secondary seal is in place to
